abstracts.cdata!:
The Privatization and Industrial Reform
            Technical Assistance Project's outcome was
            satisfactory. The project achieved all its objectives. The
            lessons drawn from this project are: 1) timely intervention
            by provision of technical and financial assistance to a
            program greatly facilitates implementation of a program as
            the technical assistance makes acquisition of critical
            expertise and procurement of necessary equipment, vehicles,
            and training possible; 2) establishment of new institutions
            can take longer than is expected; 3) careful selection of
            key management staff can make a difference between success
            and failure of a program and so is stability of staff in a
            project; and 4) beneficiaries of a project should be
            involved in pre-assistance identification of activities to
            be performed as this facilitates quick implementation of a
            project/program and improves sustainability.
